name: Aetoma Hotel

reviews.title: Tough to find but worth the effort
reviews.text: When the GPS couldn't get us close we resorted to calling the hotel and asking for help. They provided what sounded like easy directions and a few minutes later we had to call again. I loved their response.....stay where you are we will come get you! Come on how is that for customer service! They offered us a nice glass of wine and we enjoyed in on our balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is the families private home. The reception area is beautiful, the family charming and the room is quite nice. Comfortable bed, view from our balcony of the lovely town.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We requested the omelet special for breakfast and can't wait to try it.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Give the property a try, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: What more can I add? Amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay. If you are coming to Nafpflio stay here. Akis and his mum were wonderful hosts. Akis helped us park and also gave us a brilliant overview of what to do in Nafplio and where to eat. His mum made the most enormous breakfast we've ever had! The rooms are beautiful and the setting - right in the heart of town - can't be beaten. Nafplio is a wonderful town to visit and a convenient base for many top sites. We would completely recommend staying at Aetoma - it knocks the spots off of any other 'boutique' hotel we have stayed in anywhere in the world.
reviews.title: Wonderful family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have a fantastic three-night stay at Aetoma back in March 2013. We stayed in the upstairs room with the private balcony, which was lovely. The room was comfortable, the breakfast fantastic and plentiful (fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, and eggs), the WiFi speedy, and the hosts very accommodating. Parking is available behind the hotel. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Fantastic three night stay

reviews.text: Akis, your host brings you the value that all hotels should strive to achieve. I've been in boutique, grand and modest hotels worldwide - you will be remiss not to select this property. Complimentary wine, fresh coffee and cakes to your room upon welcome and custom served breakfast.

#1 thing to do in Greece: go to Navplion and stay here
reviews.text: This is an adorable bed and breakfast with maybe five rooms created out of an old house. The rooms are both modern and elegant and most come with nice balconies. It is centrally located in Navplion along its cobblestone roads, which is a beautiful town and a hidden gem in Greece. The B&B is run by Akiis and his mother. Both are some of the most hospitable people we have ever dealt with. We arrived at the place an hour and a half early, but it was no problem! They had the room ready within 10 minutes and served us coffee in the meantime. Akiis spent a good thirty minutes with us showing us what to see and where to eat in Navplion. Breakfast each morning was fantastic and waaay more food than the two of us could eat - eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruit salad, pastries, lunch meat and cheese. After we checked out, we were unable to catch a bus, so we were stranded a few more hours. Akiis and his mother were so kind in not only welcoming us back into the lobby but helping us plan the next leg of our trip in Greece.
I highly recommend Navplion to anyone visiting Greece, and if you go here, you MUST stay here!
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously stated by numerous people, the Aetoma was amazing. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by Akis and his mother, shown to our room, and given a quick overview of Nafplio. Our room was spacious and clean and our lovely bathroom was fully stocked with towels, slippers, and shower necessities. We had a lovely view from our terrace, which was furnished with a nice couch as well as two tables (should we have opted to eat outside).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This cozy B&B will make you want to extend your stay. When we couldn't find a parking place, Akis and his Mom engineered one for us. They attended to all our needs. Breakfast was sumptuous. There were four of us, and when we returned from our excursions, we played Bridge in the gathering room. The proprietors were totally accommodating. Plan to trip to Nafplio so you can stay here.
reviews.title: Hospitality and charm. Plan a trip to Nafplio just to stay at this place.

reviews.text: Here is the easiest recommendation I will ever make. I recently had the great pleasure to stay at the Aetoma Hotel. In the first place, the location is central and convenient, easy walking to charming restaurants, lovely shops and ocean swimming. Visually captivating from the exterior, one is struck by the sheer charm of the place. It was a home. It remains a home. You feel at home. What other reviewers have written over and over is true. The service is sincere and heartfelt. It shows. An example. I stupidly blundered and irretrievably locked the safe, requiring help to reopen it. Within minutes of notice, Akis (son of the proprietor), was in my room, fixing it and blaming himself and his father for choosing this model of safe. Now. Ask yourself this question: how often in your experience have you had a seller, a landlord, a service provider immediately accept responsibility for a problem? How often have you had that experience when the fault was likely *yours*? In my experience this is rare just like the people who own and run this hotel. How charming our world would be with more like them. I feel gratitude and loyalty. As for the details, dimensions, food and other wonderful aspects of the hotel, these are all well reviewed and accurate in the many excellent and highly favorable reviews herein. For my part, I can't wait to return. I have my happy memories which show with my smile whenever someone asks me about Nafplion, "Nafplion, ah yes..." Thank you Pan, Akis and team. Bravo.
reviews.title: Welcome home

reviews.text: For what this place doesn't have (swimming pool, bar, restaurant) it more than makes up for in charm.
reviews.title: Exquisite and charming little place.

reviews.text: An old house converted into a 5-room hotel. Owned and run by Mother and son (Akis) feels like you are stepping in to someone's home. Very nicely decorated with great attention to detail.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel - what great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now stop wasting your time reading this, book it and start packing.
reviews.title: Cozy and warm hotel with great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were glad that the hotel emailed us with detailed directions prior to our stay, as we used them and found the hotel with no problem upon our arrival in Nafplion! The roads were quite narrow and we ended up parking about a 5 minute walk away, which was perfect. This was a wonderful bed and breakfast that set us in a great mood on our first night in Greece. Akis met us at the door upon arrival and helped us to bring our luggage upstairs. He proceeded to give us some tips on local sights, dining establishments, and insight on the roads we were about to undertake on our travels! (Invaluable tip - take the highway, even though the shortest road may be 80km shorter - due to the mountains and weaving roads, the two will take the same time!) We only had the single night in Nafplion, but easily could have spent a few days here. We enjoyed unwinding on the balcony after exploring and grabbing dinner. The bed was comfortable and the breakfast was very extensive and delicious! We were also very impressed with the shower!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an unusual review, in that we did not actually stay at the Aetoma. I accidentally booked the hotel for the wrong night, and when we arrived, found out our reservation was actually for the previous night. The hotel manager had waited until 2:00 a.m. for arrival, and had reason to be upset with us, but instead, he helped us find a new location (there were no rooms available for the night we arrived.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only endorse what has been said by so many other reviewers. on very few occasions i have experienced such a warm and at the same time professional welcome in a hotel (or b+b). the main reason herefore is the fact that the hotel is run by the owner, pan, and her son; the buiding served as their private home before. several languages are spoken fluently; any wish was fulfilled. aetoma is indeed difficult to find - but the owner's son took the effort of meeting us at our car after patiently inquiring for our exact location. he appeared within minutes and guided us to the little square in front of the hotel; he even had blocked a parking space for us with his own car. this is just an example of the hospitality which we received. we had the smallest room - and it was just perfect, with a balcony overlooking the little square. aetoma is brilliantly located, on the edge of the historic center, which means that you avoid the noise which you do experience in some of the center-center streets, mostly pedestrian zones full of happily (and noisily) strolling tourists. the cost-benefit-ratio of aetoma is certainly unbeatable; after walking around a full day in the city (and seeing many other accomodations) this can be said firmly. efcharistopoli - many thanks .- for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't think of a nicer bed and breakfast. Located at the heart of the old town is nevertheless quiet and surprisingly accessible by car for luggage unload/load. The owners renovated their old house in a most wonderful, distinctive, and tasteful manner. Most importantly, their hospitality and service is top notch. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a bit difficult to find, but once you have arrived the service and hospitality are impossible to beat. Akis and his mother make their guests feel very special in this 5-room hotel located in the heart of Nafplio. The building has been in the family for 160 years and has been recently renovated. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. The breakfast is enormous and delicious. Akis was very helpful with directions and recommendations. Parking near the hotel is challenging but Akis makes certain that every arriving guest is taken care of. This was our best travel experience in Greece!
reviews.title: Worth a trip to Nafplio

description: In Nafplion, a city of magical breeze and unique history, a revamped mansion of the 18th century combines the beauty of the past with the comforts of the present and creates the ideal environment for relaxation and exceptional holidays. The neoclassical luxury appears in each of the 5 hospitable rooms, one of which seems like it slipped silently and took its place in the loft. Visitors feel immediately that they have found both a familiar and unique place.
